brand.name: LIS - Legume Information System
brand.slogan: Information about legume traits for crop improvement

gcvScreenshot.caption: A Search view using a genomic context from Phaseolus vulgaris (common bean) Chromosome II as the query. Note, the result genomic context from Glycine max (soybean) Chromosome I contains an inversion. Also, the Global dot plot of Arachis hypogaea (peanut) reveals an inversion not present in the Micro-Synteny viewer. Lastly, the Macro-Synteny viewer reveals that some of the result genomic contexts belong to larger syntenic structures.

trackScreenshot.caption: The anatomy of a micro-synteny query track. The gene in the center with the bold outline is the track's query gene. The genes flanking the query gene are its neighbors. The thickness of the lines between genes indicates inter-genic distance. The track's label (left) indicates the chromosome and genomic interval of the track.

microsyntenyScreenshot.caption: A micro-synteny view. The tracks on top with the bold labels are query tracks that have been multiple aligned. The tracks on bottom with regular labels are similar tracks that were found during the search. There is a variety of preservation and variation of structure in the view. Notably, there is gene presence/absence, copy-number variation, and an inversion.

dotplotsScreenshot.caption: A local dot plot (left) and a global dot plot (right). The local dot plot highlights copy-number variation of a tandem duplication and a palindromic sequence. The global dot plot shows a self-syntenic chromosome due to an ancient duplication. The duplicatoin has apparently been subjected to rearrangement.

macrosyntenyScreenshot.caption: A reference macro-synteny view (left) and a circos macro-synteny view (right). The reference view contains blocks from the other query track chromosomes as well as from chromosomes provided by the sources. The circos view contains all-pairs blocks among the query track chromosomes.
